document.publication: The Poems of Emily Dickinson, Variorum Edition, Franklin, 1998
document.full_text: <xhtml:p class="text_p"><xhtml:span class="text_edgespan"> </xhtml:span></xhtml:p><xhtml:p class="text_p"><xhtml:span class="text_edgespan">    </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_word">A </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_coloredword" style="color:#a8e0ff">chastened </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_coloredword" style="color:#84c4e0">Grace </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_word">is </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_word">twice </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_word">a </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_coloredword" style="color:#84c4e0">Grace </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_word">- </xhtml:span></xhtml:p><xhtml:p class="text_p"><xhtml:span class="text_edgespan">    </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_coloredword" style="color:#301034">Nay, </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_word">'tis </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_word">a </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_coloredword" style="color:#301034">Holiness. </xhtml:span></xhtml:p>
document.title: A chastened grace is twice a grace
